| An intoner:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead").
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* appears only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* can leave an old 1 corpse.
* resists death magic.
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming").
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |

The **intoner**, n, is a monster that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"). It is a high-level [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") [nymph](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph"); in addition to its [thieving](/wiki/Theft_\(attack\) "Theft (attack)") attacks, it can use weapons and arcane spellcasting.

## Generation

Unlike most nymphs, intoners are never generated asleep.

Intoners may appear on the [Anachrononaut quest](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest "Anachrononaut quest"); [random monster generation](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest#Quest_monsters "Anachrononaut quest") in this quest branch has about a 0.5953% probability of creating an intoner.

## Encyclopedia

People who can use the power of song to wield vast  
attacking force. Six of them, all female, have been  
recorded throughout history. The Intoners freed each land  
from the despotic rulers that once terrorized their  
people, and are now worshipped as saviors.  
\[ Drakengard III ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Intoner

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
n intoner (No tile)
Difficulty 35
Attacks Weapon 1d8 physical, Weapon 1d8 physical, Claw 0d0 steal item, Claw 0d0 seduction, Cast 1d8 mage spell
n intoner (No tile)
Difficulty 35
Attacks

Weapon 1d8 physical, Weapon 1d8 physical, Claw 0d0 steal item, Claw 0d0 seduction, Cast 1d8 mage spell

Base level 30
Base experience 1161
Speed 14
Base AC 0
Base MR 30
Alignment −10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 0
Nutritional value 0
Size medium
Resistances cold, poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed cold

An intoner:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • can leave an old 1 corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • cannot be tamed.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

The intoner, n, is a monster that appears in dNetHack. It is a high-level undead nymph; in addition to its thieving attacks, it can use weapons and arcane spellcasting.

Generation

Unlike most nymphs, intoners are never generated asleep.

Intoners may appear on the Anachrononaut quest; random monster generation in this quest branch has about a 0.5953% probability of creating an intoner.

Encyclopedia

People who can use the power of song to wield vast
attacking force. Six of them, all female, have been
recorded throughout history. The Intoners freed each land
from the despotic rulers that once terrorized their
people, and are now worshipped as saviors.
[ Drakengard III ]

The '''intoner''', {{magenta|n}}, is a monster that appears in [[dNetHack]]. It is a high-level [[undead]] [[nymph]]; in addition to its [[theft (attack)|thieving]] attacks, it can use weapons and arcane spellcasting.

==Generation==
Unlike most nymphs, intoners are never generated asleep.

Intoners may appear on the [[Anachrononaut quest]]; [[Anachrononaut quest#Quest monsters|random monster generation]] in this quest branch has about a 0.5953% probability of creating an intoner.
